items.prompt: At work, A colleague says, "If launch quality is high, QA pass rate rises. QA pass rate rose, so launch quality must be high." What is the best next move?
options: Use a structural check and test disconfirming evidence before concluding
Trust the first plausible pattern and proceed
Rely on confidence and skip formal checks
Use one anecdote as proof
items.why_right: The structural/disconfirming check prevents this specific reasoning failure.
why_traps: Plausibility alone is not sufficient evidence.
